    Checks if the feature's tagtable contains the given common key, and returns its value in the following form: Bit 0: type (0=number, 1=string) Bit 1: size flag (0=narrow, 1=wide) Bit 2-15: undefined Bits 16-31: narrow value Bits 32-63: pointer to wide value If the value is narrow, bits 32-63 are undefined.

      Description copied from interface: Feature

    • hashCode

    • getCommonKeyValue

      protected long getCommonKeyValue(int pTags, int key)
      Checks if the feature's tagtable contains the given common key, and returns its value in the following form: Bit 0: type (0=number, 1=string) Bit 1: size flag (0=narrow, 1=wide) Bit 2-15: undefined Bits 16-31: narrow value Bits 32-63: pointer to wide value If the value is narrow, bits 32-63 are undefined. If the value is wide, bits 16-31 are undefined. If the key is not found, this method returns 0.
      Parameters:
      pTags - pointer to tagtable
      key - common key
      Returns:
      the tag value (see above) or 0 if not found

    • getKeyValue

      protected long getKeyValue(String keyString)
      Checks if the feature's tagtable contains the given key, and returns its value in the following form: Bit 0: type (0=number, 1=string) Bit 1: size flag (0=narrow, 1=wide) Bit 2-15: undefined Bits 16-31: narrow value Bits 32-63: pointer to wide value If the value is narrow, bits 32-63 are undefined. If the value is wide, bits 16-31 are undefined. If the key is not found, this method returns 0.
      Parameters:
      keyString -
      Returns:

    • isArea

      public boolean isArea()
      Description copied from interface: Feature
      Checks whether this Feature represents an area. Areas are closed ways that have certain tags (e.g. landuse), or are explicitly tagged with area=yes; or relations that represent (multi-) polygons.
      Specified by:
      isArea in interface Feature
      Returns:
      true if this feature is an area, otherwise false

    • role

      public String role()
      Description copied from interface: Feature
      If this Feature was returned by a call to Relation.members() (or its variants) of a Relation, returns this Feature's role in that Relation.
      Specified by:
      role in interface Feature
      Returns:
      the feature's role, or an empty String (if the feature is a member without an assigned role), or `null` if it was obtained via another kind of query

    • getRelationTablePtr

      protected int getRelationTablePtr()
      Retrieves the pointer to the feature's relation table. The feature must be a member of at least one relation, otherwise the result of this method will be invalid.
      Returns:
      a pointer to the feature's relation table
